events.text: This next class is about algebraic formulas and operations

An algebraic identity is an equation that is always true regardless of the values assigned to the variables. Identity means that the left-hand side of the equation is identical to the right-hand side, for all values of the variables.
These formulas involve squares and cubes of algebraic expressions and help in solving the algebraic expressions in a few quick steps. The most frequently used algebraic formulas are the next ones
And the basic operations covered in algebra are addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division
Addition: For the addition operation in algebra, two or more expressions are separated by a plus (+) sign between them
Subtraction: For the subtraction operation in algebra, two or more expressions are separated by a minus (-) sign between them
Multiplication: For the multiplication operation in algebra, two or more expressions are separated by a multiplication (Ã—) sign between them
Division: For the division operation in algebra, two or more expressions are separated by a "/" sign between them
